data.title: Talk:DO NOT UPLOAD
data.text:
Reorganizing the DNU List.

Wanted to get thoughts on others on reorganizing the DNU list. I have a few points I wanted to see what others thought about.

1. Is there really a need for the "expired licensed" list to be in there? It seems to be a waste to me on a list of what you can and cannot upload it seems pointless to have a "almost not allowed, or used to not be allowed to upload list".

2. Leave it organized by company then alpha per company. One big list alphabetically or maybe link to an alphabetical list and keep it organized by company?

3. An addition to point #1, but slightly different. The Otherwise Involved list.. some of it isn't on, and some of it is on here. After working out which isn't allowed and which is (and maybe just hasn't been up'ed) I think it would make sense just to combine it what's not allowed with the main DNU.

Taking the expired license stuff off. Adding the otherwise involved lists (after confirming it isn't allowed), and just putting them in with the main list will make the DNU list easier to look through. This also will hopefully help make things more clear on what is and isn't allowed.

It would then look something like this (I removed the opening header with the Controlled releases / DNU of certain sub groups, etc.) That looked fine.

I just copy pasted the otherwise involved in until I get a chance to confirm each one and remove duplicates and inconsistencies. There are a few on both lists for 2 different companies. Possibly before the list by companies begins have a link to a page that just has all the titles together in alphabetical order.

Also, I apologize for all the edits, it's been awhile since I've done anything with wiki pages. I dropped the section headings by 1 level each on the talk page, they'd be bumped back up 1 each on the acutal page. —Preceding unsigned comment added by Arveene (talk • contribs) 04:23, 3 February 2009

[Archived list; removed from wiki on 03-Sep-2009]

Central Park Media just filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy on 27/04/09 (source: ANN). Regardless, their titles remain on the DNU list until staff say otherwise.

Disagreeable fansubs

Removed ILA from the list.

14:55:33 <@kureshii> i just realised that ILA is pretty much dead 14:56:29 <@kureshii> their website is down, their channel is dead with a minimal population, they've hardly released anything in recent months, and they're just sitting around being asses 14:56:42 <@kureshii> think it's time to take them off the DNU list? 14:58:49 <@kureshii> oh, their torrents and shit are kinda dead too 14:59:15 <@kureshii> so we can't possibly steal their leechers/seeders away when they don't even seem to have a distro of sorts 15:12:56 <%newy> I don't see reasons against it 15:15:21 <@Southrop> same 15:15:22 <@Southrop> go for it

kureshii 11:46, 16 September 2010 (UTC)

Not sure I understand this, specific groups can opt out of having their releases hosted on Baka? +Yc 03:08, 2 September 2012 (UTC)

Alphabetical

Shouldn't we list Aniplex then Digital Media BEFORE Funimation and NIS America? +Yc 03:08, 2 September 2012 (UTC)

Missing stuff
